comments:
If you start Jalopy (Plug-In to format java-code), the Plug-In crashes eclipse if you interact with any GUI-Element of the Plug-In. This is no issue on the windows plattform.


!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 1 1 Nov 16, 2002 23:27:45.878
!MESSAGE Could not load library: libcore_2_0_5.jnilib.  This library provides platform-specific optimizations for certain file-system operations.  This library is not present on all platforms, so this may not be an error.  The resources plugin will safely fall back to using java.io.File functionality.

This is eclipse-SDK-N20021115

The class de.hunsicker.jalopy.plugin.AbstractPlugin creates an AWT cursor which 
triggers loading of ui.jar and the associated AWT dll (see stacktrace below).
Since initializing AWT on Mac OS X creates its own event loop, it cannot coexist with 
SWT.

So in order to get jalopy working within Eclipse on all platforms, the dependency on AWT 
has to be removed completely.
